alert.note: Alert for Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee and northwestern Sumter Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cartersville to near Shaw Air Base. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Bishopville, Lee State Park, Oakland, Sumter County Airport, Elliott, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Dalzell, Manville, Spring Hill, St. Charles, Wisacky, Woodrow and Stateburg. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 106 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
